node.title: US Capitol rioter 'QAnon Shaman' sentenced to over three years in prison
node.alt: Jacob Chansley looks into the camera as he wears horns and a fur hat with face paint on.
node.description: Jacob Chansley, the so-called "Qanon Shaman", is sentenced to almost three and a half years in prison for his role in the US Capitol riots in January 6.
node.content:
["The so-called \"Qanon Shaman\"\u00a0has been sentenced to almost three and a half years in prison for his role in the US Capitol riots on January 6.", "Jacob Chansley became known as the Shaman for the horned headdress he wore as he stormed the Capitol building with hundreds of others, in an attempt to overturn former US president Donald Trump's election defeat.", "Prosecutors had asked for a 51-month sentence, but the judge said he believed Chansley,\u00a0who pleaded guilty,\u00a0had done \"a lot\"\u00a0to prove he was \"on the right track\"\u00a0and instead gave him 41 months behind bars.", "Chansley\u00a0pleaded guilty in September to obstructing an official proceeding. The rioters had\u00a0tried\u00a0to stop Congress from certifying Joe Biden's election.", "Last week, Judge Royce Lamberth imposed the same sentence on a former mixed martial artist who was filmed punching a police officer during the violence.", "The 41-month\u00a0prison terms\u00a0are the stiffest sentences handed down in any of the roughly 675 riot prosecutions resulting from the riots.", "Chansley's attorney asked the judge for a sentence of time served for his client, who has been detained since his January arrest.", "", "
The rioters had\u00a0tried\u00a0to stop Congress from certifying President Joe Biden's election.(AP: Jose Luis Magana)
", "Chansley appeared in court in a dark green prison jumpsuit, with a beard and shaved head.", "", "
Though he was not accused of violence, Chansley acknowledged he was among the first 30 rioters in the building.(AP:\u00a0Alexandria Sheriff's Office)
", "\"The hardest part of this is that I know I am to blame,\" Chansley said in a lengthy statement before he was sentenced, describing a difficult childhood and saying he had taken responsibility for his behaviour.", "\"I thought I was going to get 20 years solitary confinement,\" he said.", "While in detention, Chansley was diagnosed by prison officials with transient schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, depression and anxiety.", "When he entered his guilty plea, Chansley said he was disappointed Mr Trump had not pardoned him.", "Mr Trump was impeached by the House of Representatives and acquitted by the Senate on a charge of inciting the January\u00a06 riot for a fiery speech that preceded it in which he told his followers to \"fight like hell\".", "
Bannon pleads not guilty
", "", "
Steve Bannon and his attorney speak with reporters after leaving court.(AP: Alex Brandon)
", "Mr Trump's longtime adviser Steve Bannon pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to criminal charges of defying a congressional subpoena from a US\u00a0House panel investigating the\u00a0Capitol riot, according to court documents.", "Mr Bannon, who made his initial court appearance\u00a0on Monday, was indicted last week by a federal grand jury on two counts of contempt of Congress.", "Mr Bannon has vowed to fight the congressional subpoena, telling reporters outside the courthouse\u00a0that he believed\u00a0the prosecution was a politically motivated attack against him by Mr Biden, Attorney-General Merrick Garland and House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi.", "He was due to be arraigned in court on Thursday, but agreed to waive his right to a formal reading of the indictment, according to court documents filed on Wednesday.", "", "
How did protesters get into the Capitol building?
", "Four people died in the Capitol\u00a0riots.", "A Capitol Police officer who had been attacked by protesters died the day after the riot and four police officers who took part in the defence of the Capitol later took their own lives.", "About 140 police officers were injured.", "Most of the guilty pleas in January 6 prosecutions so far have been in cases involving non-violent misdemeanours, but US politicians are seeking prison sentences for some defendants facing more serious felony charges.\u00a0", "ABC/wires"]
